content: vicki scarf as i was working on brenna scarf and shawlette i had an idea for a more rectangular scarf with pointed ends that would have brenna s edging all the way around it instead of just on the bottom edge basically just think of this as a two-sided brenna you can work just a few increases to make a nice one-skein scarf approx 8 wide unblocked or work a great deal more increases for more of a stole or wrap 18+ wide unblocked if you follow my patterns you know that i love the no turning chain double_crochet tutorial available on youtube therefore in this pattern all of my row will start with a double_crochet if you do not know how to do the no turning chain double_crochet or simply prefer not to you may substitute a ch3 for the first double_crochet be sure to turn after every row materials needed  fingering weight yarn 100g  h hook  yarn needle special stitches  shell 2dc ch1 2dc all in indicated stitch or chain space  shell in shell work a shell into the chain space of the shell beneath it  decrease * yo insert hook in next st yo and pull a loop through yo and pull through 2 loops * 2 loops on hook repeat from * to * 3 loops on hook yo and pull through all 3 loops  dc3tog * yo insert hook in next st yo and pull a loop through yo and pull through 2 loops * 2 loops on hook repeat from * to * 2 times 4 loops on hook yo and pull through all 4 loops  dc6tog * yo insert hook in next st yo and pull a loop through yo and pull through 2 loops * 2 loops on hook repeat from * to * 5 times 7 loops on hook yo and pull through all 7 loops but be sure to follow the special directions on the last row begin with magic_ring row 1 2dc ch1 2dc ch1 2dc row 2 ch2 shell in first chain space ch1 shell in last chain space row 3 ch2 shell in shell ch1 double_crochet in chain space ch1 shell in shell row 4 ch2 shell in shell ch1 3dc in double_crochet ch1 shell in shell row 5 ch2 shell in shell ch1 2dc in first double_crochet 1dc 2dc in last double_crochet ch1 shell in shell row 6 ch2 shell in shell ch1 2dc in first double_crochet 3dc 2dc in last double_crochet ch1 shell in shell repeat row 6 being sure to add 2 to the sts between the increases until you have increased to your desired width then… non-increase row ch2 shell in shell ch1 double_crochet in ea double_crochet ch1 shell in shell … until you are at your desired scarf length then begin your decrease row d row d row ch2 shell in shell ch1 decrease double_crochet to next to last st decrease ch1 shell in
